Cindy and Mary were playing at recess. They were having a great time until Cindy brought
ewlineup Allison's birthday party. Cindy had been invited to it, but Mary had not. This hurt
ewlineMary's feelings a lot. The girls kept on playing and Mary was trying to have fun, but all
ewlineshe felt like doing was crying. She couldn't believe that she had not been invited to
ewlineAllison's birthday party. She thought that they were friends and if her best friend Cindy
ewlinehad been invited, why not her?
ewline
ewlineAfter recess was over, the class walked back into the school. Mary saw Allison in line and
ewlinetried to smile, but it was hard. Cindy felt horrible now that she had talked about the
ewlineparty that her friend was not going to.
ewline
ewlineMary found it hard to pay attention to the teacher now. She kept thinking over and over
ewlinewhy Allison didn't invite her to the party. Did Mary do something to make Allison mad or
ewlineto hurt her? She couldn't understand it. Her eyes started to get wet with tears. She was
ewlinehoping that no one saw this. Mary thought she saw Allison looking at her in a funny
ewlineway. Suddenly Mary felt like she was going to start crying. She reached into her desk to
ewlinepull out some tissues. She felt a strange  piece of paper. She pulled it out and there was
ewlinethe invitation to Allison's party. It had gotten mixed up in her papers in her desk. She
ewlineimmediately started to smile. She smiled at Allison and at Cindy. Cindy gave her a puzzled
ewlinelook because she thought that Mary was sad. 
ewline
ewlineAt lunch Mary explained everything to Cindy. Then Mary, Allison, and Cindy all went off to
ewlineplay.
